idea-plugin.name: Comma Complete Edition (Raku Language Support)
idea-plugin.description:
The Comma Complete plugin provides Raku language support for IDEA-based IDEs. Features include:

  • Detailed and customizable syntax highlighting
  • Auto-completion of various program elements
  • Live code analysis to detect common problems
  • Numerous code navigation features
  • A range of refactorings, such as rename, extract variable, and extract method
  • Running scripts
  • Running tests and viewing the results
  • Debugging
  • Test coverage reporting
  • Profiling

The same functionality is also available as an independent IDE. For more details, see the Comma website.
idea-plugin.change-notes:
• Add a new UI tab displaying profiling results related to garbage collection It allows one to see when garbage collection has occurred during program execution, how long it took, how much memory was reclaimed, and how much moved to the second generation
  • Add a new UI tab displaying profiling results related to allocation It allows to see what types of objects were allocated during program execution, how much memory those allocations take, and which routines performed the allocations
  • In the Routines tab of the profiler UI, clicking on a routine available in the current project opens an editor at the routine declaration location
  • Reduce memory consumption resulting from caching information about modules (the caching is done in order to more rapidly open additional or different projects in the same Comma session)
  • Fix Create Desktop Entry action in Tools menu
  • Fix false negatives for an annotation warning about some modules not being found in the ecosystem
  • Fix a bug where symbols of the Cro::HTTP::Test module were not resolved properly
